cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move WNW across Hispaniola, then turn northwest and parallel the east coast of Florida toward Georgia–South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: likely near the southeast coast of Florida (around the Miami–West Palm Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas from Cat Island to San Salvador (no U.S. coastline yet under watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S./British Virgin Islands, southern and northern coasts of Dominican Republic, north coast of Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire east Florida coastline northward into coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Sunday into Monday with a 25% cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and low (3%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft above ground level possible along the northeast Florida coast if the center tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals if the core brushes the coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and short-fuse coastal squalls that could disrupt vessel loading/unloading operations.
